page.title: 14Village on the River Kirtle
page.content: Kirtlebridge is a small village of mostly re-conditioned houses there are few new houses. The Post Office also does bed and breakfast and the Pine Kraft workshop is at the back. There is a public telephone kiosk and post box. The village hall was built by public subscription in 1906 and cloakrooms added in 1951. It is used by the Kirtle Kirk as a church hall with an annual Ceildh in aid of Hall funds. There is a Recreation Club for 5-12 year olds. The do an annual Pantomime and meet once a week. There is a Mother and Toddler's Group, and a Children's Social which arranges a Christmas party and a summer trip for all the village children.
